alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 7:41PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Lincoln County through 830 PM CDT... At 740 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles south of Stapleton to near Hershey. Movement was southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... North Platte, Hershey, Brady, Maxwell, Lake Maloney State Recreation Area, North Platte Airport, Keith, Cottonwood Canyon State Wildlife Management Area, Jeffrey Canyon State Wildlife Management Area and Birdwood. This includes the following highways... Highway 97 between mile markers 1 and 8. Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 163 and 202. Highway 83 between mile markers 69 and 105. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southwestern Nebraska.
